definition: contrary/in reverse/inside out or upside down/to reverse/to return/to oppose/opposite/against/anti-/to rebel/to use analogy/instead/abbr. for 反切[fan3 qie4] phonetic system
echo/sound/noise/to make a sound/to sound/to ring/loud/classifier for noises

sentences.english: The social effect of an evening of one-on-one theatre is interesting.
sentences.chinese: 这一夜一对一剧场的社会反响很有意思。

sentences.english: Feng Gong one of the better performing repercussions.
sentences.chinese: 其中冯巩的表演获得较好反响。

sentences.english: But the subject arouses strong emotions in other countries.
sentences.chinese: 但兵役制度在其他国家引起了强大的反响。

sentences.english: This has caused a flurry of excitement in some state-controlled newspapers.
sentences.chinese: 他的发言在一些由国家控制的报纸上激起了强烈反响。

sentences.english: Moving people with emotions and convincing them with reason, Premier Wen's speech received warm responses.
sentences.chinese: 温总理的演讲动情晓理，引起热烈反响。

sentences.english: A recent report released by the government has caused nationwide repercussions (echoes).
sentences.chinese: 最近发布的一份报告在全国引起反响。

sentences.english: The president's death had unexpected repercussion.
sentences.chinese: 总统的逝世引起出乎意料的反响。

sentences.english: The intense reflection is stirred with the startup of medium-term notes(MTN).
sentences.chinese: 中期票据市场的启动在我国金融业引起强烈反响。

sentences.english: The publishing of this report has evoked great repercussions in society.
sentences.chinese: 这次报道刊出后，在社会上产生了不小的反响。

sentences.english: It ripples out，moreover，to the heartstrings that will tug， And always leaves an echo that is very like a hug.
sentences.chinese: 它的涟漪深深波及心弦，总会留下反响，宛若拥抱。

sentences.english: His words aroused no echoes in their hearts.
sentences.chinese: 他的话没有在他们心中引起反响。

sentences.english: The two would often stage performances at the cantina, achieving a moderate level of success.
sentences.chinese: 他们俩经常在酒馆里演出，但反响平平。

sentences.english: Children can sharpen their mental reflexes by learning to play chess.
sentences.chinese: 儿童学下棋可以进步灵活反响的本领。

sentences.english: The response to the exhibition has been “overwhelmingly positive,” said Willis.
sentences.chinese: 威利斯说，人们对这次摄影展反响非常积极。

sentences.english: The only sound that echoed in its dark dome was that of incantations which I chanted.
sentences.chinese: 在沉黑的仰顶上，独一的声音是我礼赞的反响。

sentences.english: His oratorical efforts evoked no response in his audience.
sentences.chinese: 他的雄辩在听众中不起反响。

definition: to cause a sensation/to create a stir in (a place)/commotion/controversy
public praise/public reputation/commonly held opinions/current idiom
to win instant success (idiom)/to start off successfully
to broadcast/to air (a TV program etc)
a shout/fig. opinion or demand, esp. expressed by a group
to win instant success (idiom)/to become an instant hit
